moves.1. e4: A very famous move. King's pawn opening
moves.1... e5: Double K's P opening. AKA open game.
moves.2... Nc6: Protecting the e5 and and controlling some important squares
moves.4. Bc4:
Italian variation.
Better is Bb5 Spanish variation.
moves.5. Bxf7+: Equalizing the material and forcing the K to give up castling right
moves.7. Neg5+: Gets out of danger with tempo
moves.7... Kg8 8. d3: Controlling the e4 and making way for the B
moves.9... Bxh3:
Disrupting K wing.
Bg4 is also strong.
moves.12. Be3: Bad move. Blk will win a piece.
moves.16. Kd1 Qxh3: Another good looking move is Kh7
moves.17... Kh7 18. c3: Ne4 so W can play Kd2 to connect the Rs
moves.18... Rf5 19. Ne4: Good placement, on a white sq with tempo
moves.21. Rad1 Nd8: I wanted to exchange the best W piece
moves.22. Kc1 Ne6 23. Kb1: White is waiting for a mistake from black. As he can not do much.
moves.23... Ng5: With out removing the central N, its hard to win the game for blk
moves.25. d4: W wants to generate counter with c d e Ps supported by major pieces
moves.31... Qxe4+ 32. Ka1 Qe2 33. Qxe2: This time blk is successful in removing the Qs
moves.35. h3 Rff2 36. Kb1 Kg6 37. Rd7:
One of the Rs will be exchanged by force.
38 Rd8 better than the text.
moves.42. Ke2 Kh5: So K can support the P
moves.43. Kf1 g4 44. Kg2 Kh4 45. Re4 Re3 46. R: Forcing the K to give up h3 sq
moves.47. Kf1 Rf2+ 48. Ke1 Rf5 49. Ke2 Kh3: Rest of the moves are very simple, Blk is winning easily. W Resigned.
